lines.text: [Lewis stops Trevor from mooning people]
Trevor, it isn't nice to moon.
Oh, it isn't?
No, it isn't.
Mr. Ogre mooned.
Well, you see Trevor, Mr. Ogre is a converted nerd, ok? He used to be a jock so he's still a little rough around the edges.
Jacques, is he from France?
Stan, you are such a nerd!
I sure am!
I think you're breaking out.
What're you talking about? I've always had a perfect complexion.
Uh-uh, I think you have the chickenpox.
Lewis, I don't want you to go now, it's after 3 in the morning.
If my wife and my unborn fetal son want pickles and ice cream, I don't care what time it is.
It's not that bad.

Not that bad? Lewis, we just had a food fight. People don't have... food fights, at their... BRIDAL SHOWERS! But I did! Some nova riche guy, looked like he could've been a banker, is standing over me, shoving handfuls of garnish up my NOSTRILS!
It's on!
What's on?
The wedding.
First it's on, then it's off, now it's on again. I am a humble servant, not a yo-yo.
Everybody who's important is gone.
No, no look, your sister's still here.
My sister stays to the end of supermarket openings.
How's my unborn grandson?
You mean you're unborn fetal son?
[laughs]
So what do you like to do?
I'm afraid to tell you because if you don't like what I like, then you won't like me.
I think I'm going to like you, no matter WHAT you do, as long as you live.
It's not your fault, you didn't ask to be born... you want me to give you a push on those swings?
No thanks.
I'm a pretty good swing pusher, I can get you in over the top.
I'm too old to be pushed on swings.
Oh yeah, you're too old for that... I used to hate it when people treated me like a baby.
To hell with my father!
I was hoping you'd say that!
I'd like to thank you all for this wonderful shower.
It's probably the first shower you've ever had.
No, he showered regularly, every other night in summer, and weekly in the winter.
Lewis, there were women at the party last night, weren't there?
Yeah.
Were they pretty?
Yeah.
What did you do with them?
The bunny hop.
That's it? Just the bunny hop?
Yeah.
Okay, then you can still be my Valentine.
Harold where're you going?
I don't know but I'd guess over to Lois.
Are you scoing, Harold?
Well I wouldn't tell you if I was. But I'll guarantee you this much, I ain't going over there for breakfast!
It's on!
What's on?
The wedding!
You're not supposed to reveal what goes on at a bachelor party.
Wild horses couldn't drag it out of me. Who can't we tell again?
Hey. What's Trevor Gulf doing?

[startled]
I-I think he's mooning us.
That's no moon, thats the San Joquin valley
[shouts, running at Trevor as people began to react off-screen]
TREVOR, NO!

[takes photo of Trevor's mooning]
Oh! Big Smile!
Betty, don't push.

[chanting]
Betty don't push, Betty don't push, Betty don't push, Betty don't push, hee hee hoo, hee hee hoo, hee hee hoo.
[Betty screams]
Betty don't scream! Betty don't scream, Betty don't scream.
I love Booger! And I'm gonna marry him, no matter WHAT you say!
Jeanie!
[to Aaron]
What did you say to her?
Nothing, I just made a suggestion.
Oh, can't we all just get along?
She comes up with a guy who looks like he came out of a vending machine and I'M the one who's wrong!

[to Heidi]
You gave up what you wanted to tell the truth, I admire that quality in a person.
It's on!
What's on?
The wedding!
I'm sure my mother's just overwhelmed by the wedding and everything.
Oh, then you don't think it's because they hate my guts?
Booger, I love you!
Yeah, I know *you* do, but I'm not sure about your parents.
I've never been to a nerd wedding
[bursts into tears]
I didn't cry at!
The bishop has a kidney stone, he no make it to wedding!
How am I supposed to get married without a clergyman?
I could marry you.
But I don't love you.
